control.name: Whitelist to which URLs the application can redirect to
control.desc: The application should maintain a list of the URLs to which it can redirect. This whitelisting can also be done by applying a regular expression. The application should only allow redirects to trusted URLS.

test.steps:
1. Identify the points of the application in which a redirection takes place. Redirections are usually indicated by the use of the """"Location"""" HTTP header along with the 3xx code.
  2. If the content which is ending up inside the Location header is coming from user input (URL string, Cookies, HTTP headers, forms, etc.), then.
  3. Using a browser, modify the input value which will be part of the Location header to set up domains which should not be permitted.
